content:
Duration Struct

In this Article

Represents the duration of time that a Timeline is active.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.Windows.DurationConverter))]
public struct Duration

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.ValueType
  • Duration

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="[days.]hours:minutes:seconds[.fractionalSeconds]"/>

- or -

<object property="[days.]hours:minutes"/>

- or -

<object property="Automatic"/>

- or -

<object property="Forever"/>

XAML Values

days

System.Int32

A value greater than or equal to 0 that describes the number of days spanned by this duration.

hours

System.Int32

A value between 0 and 23 that represents the number of hours spanned by this duration.

minutes

System.Int32

A value between 0 and 59 that represents the number of minutes spanned by this duration.

seconds

System.Int32

A value between 0 and 59 that represents the number of seconds spanned by this duration

fractionalSeconds

System.Int32

A value consisting of 1 to 7 digits that represents fractional seconds.

Constructors summary

Duration(TimeSpan)

Initializes a new instance of the Duration structure with the supplied TimeSpan value.

Properties summary

Automatic

Gets a Duration value that is automatically determined.
Forever

Gets a Duration value that represents an infinite interval.
HasTimeSpan

Gets a value that indicates if this Duration represents a TimeSpan value.
TimeSpan

Gets the TimeSpan value that this Duration represents.

Methods summary

Add(Duration)

Adds the value of the specified instance of Duration to the value of the current instance.
Compare(Duration,Duration)

Compares one Duration value to another.
Equals(Object)

Determines whether a specified object is equal to an instance of Duration.
Equals(Duration)

Determines whether a specified Duration is equal to this instance of Duration.
Equals(Duration,Duration)

Determines whether two instances of Duration are equal.
GetHashCode()

Gets a hash code for this instance.
Plus(Duration)

Returns the specified instance of Duration.
Subtract(Duration)

Subtracts the value of the specified instance of Duration from this instance.
ToString()

Converts an instance of Duration to a String representation.

Operators summary

op_Addition(Duration,Duration)

Adds two instances of Duration together.
op_Equality(Duration,Duration)

Determines whether two instances of Duration are equal.
op_GreaterThan(Duration,Duration)

Determines if one instance of Duration is greater than another.
op_GreaterThanOrEqual(Duration,Duration)

Determines whether an instance of Duration is greater than or equal to another instance.
op_Implicit(TimeSpan)
op_Inequality(Duration,Duration)

Determines if two instances of Duration are not equal.
op_LessThan(Duration,Duration)

Determines if the value of one instance of Duration is less than the value of another instance.
op_LessThanOrEqual(Duration,Duration)

Determines if the value of one instance of Duration is less than or equal to the value of another instance.
op_Subtraction(Duration,Duration)

Subtracts the value of one instance of Duration from another.
op_UnaryPlus(Duration)

Returns the specified instance of Duration.

Constructors

  • Duration(TimeSpan)

    Initializes a new instance of the Duration structure with the supplied TimeSpan value.

    public Duration (TimeSpan timeSpan);

    Parameters

    • timeSpan
      TimeSpan

      Represents the initial time interval of this duration.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      Occurs when timeSpan is initialized to a negative value.

Properties

  • Automatic

    Gets a Duration value that is automatically determined.

    public static System.Windows.Duration Automatic { get; }

    Property Value

    • Duration

      A Duration initialized to an automatic value.

    Remarks

    XAML Attribute Usage

    <object property="Automatic" />

    XAML Values

    property
    A property that accepts a Duration value.

  • Forever

    Gets a Duration value that represents an infinite interval.

    public static System.Windows.Duration Forever { get; }

    Property Value

    • Duration

      A Duration initialized to a forever value.

    Remarks

    XAML Attribute Usage

    <object property="Forever" />

    XAML Values

    property
    A property that accepts a Duration value.

  • HasTimeSpan

    Gets a value that indicates if this Duration represents a TimeSpan value.

    public bool HasTimeSpan { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      True if this Duration is a TimeSpan value; otherwise, false.

  • TimeSpan

    Gets the TimeSpan value that this Duration represents.

    public TimeSpan TimeSpan { get; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      The TimeSpan value that this Duration represents.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      Occurs if Duration is null.

Methods

  • Add(Duration)

    Adds the value of the specified instance of Duration to the value of the current instance.

    public System.Windows.Duration Add (System.Windows.Duration duration);

    Parameters

    • duration
      Duration

      An instance of Duration that represents the value of the current instance plus duration.

    Returns

    • Duration

      If both instances of Duration have values, an instance of Duration that represents the combined values. Otherwise this method returns null.

  • Compare(Duration,Duration)

    Compares one Duration value to another.

    public static int Compare (System.Windows.Duration t1, System.Windows.Duration t2);

    Parameters

    • t1
      Duration

      The first instance of Duration to compare.

    • t2
      Duration

      The second instance of Duration to compare.

    Returns

    • Int32

      If t1 is less than t2, a negative value that represents the difference. If t1 is equal to t2, zero. If t1 is greater than t2, a positive value that represents the difference.

    Remarks

    Duration instances with a property value of Automatic are a special case with the following return values.

    • If t1 is Automatic and t2 is not, -1 is returned.

    • If t1 is Automatic and t2 is also Automatic, 0 is returned.

    • If t1 is not Automatic and t2 is Automatic, 1 is returned.

  • Equals(Object)

    Determines whether a specified object is equal to an instance of Duration.

    public override bool Equals (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Object

      Object to check for equality.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if value is equal to the current instance of Duration; otherwise, false.

  • Equals(Duration)

    Determines whether a specified Duration is equal to this instance of Duration.

    public bool Equals (System.Windows.Duration duration);

    Parameters

    • duration
      Duration

      Instance of Duration to check for equality.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if duration is equal to the current instance of Duration; otherwise, false.

  • Equals(Duration,Duration)

    Determines whether two instances of Duration are equal.

    public static bool Equals (System.Windows.Duration t1, System.Windows.Duration t2);

    Parameters

    • t1
      Duration

      First instance of Duration to compare.

    • t2
      Duration

      Second instance of Duration to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if t1 is equal to t2; otherwise, false.

  • GetHashCode()

    Gets a hash code for this instance.

    public override int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      A signed 32-bit integer hash code.

  • Plus(Duration)

    Returns the specified instance of Duration.

    public static System.Windows.Duration Plus (System.Windows.Duration duration);

    Parameters

    • duration
      Duration

      The instance of Duration to get.

    Returns

    • Duration

      An instance of Duration.

  • Subtract(Duration)

    Subtracts the value of the specified instance of Duration from this instance.

    public System.Windows.Duration Subtract (System.Windows.Duration duration);

    Parameters

    • duration
      Duration

      The instance of Duration to subtract from the current instance.

    Returns

    • Duration

      A new instance of Duration whose value is the result of this instance minus the value of duration.

  • ToString()

    Converts an instance of Duration to a String representation.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A String representation of this instance of Duration.

Operators

  • op_Addition(Duration,Duration)

    Adds two instances of Duration together.

    public static System.Windows.Duration op_Addition (System.Windows.Duration t1, System.Windows.Duration t2);

    Parameters

    • t1
      Duration

      The first instance of Duration to add.

    • t2
      Duration

      The second instance of Duration to add.

    Returns

    • Duration

      If both instances of Duration have TimeSpan values, this method returns the sum of those two values. If either value is set to stem.Windows.Duration.Automatic*, the method returns stem.Windows.Duration.Automatic*. If either value is set to stem.Windows.Duration.Forever*, the method returns stem.Windows.Duration.Forever*.

      If either t1 or t2 has no value, this method returns null.

  • op_Equality(Duration,Duration)

    Determines whether two instances of Duration are equal.

    public static bool op_Equality (System.Windows.Duration t1, System.Windows.Duration t2);

    Parameters

    • t1
      Duration

      The first instance of Duration to compare.

    • t2
      Duration

      The second instance of Duration to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if both instances of Duration have values and are equal, or if both instances of Duration are null. Otherwise, this method returns false.

  • op_GreaterThan(Duration,Duration)

    Determines if one instance of Duration is greater than another.

    public static bool op_GreaterThan (System.Windows.Duration t1, System.Windows.Duration t2);

    Parameters

    • t1
      Duration

      The first instance of Duration to compare.

    • t2
      Duration

      The second instance of Duration to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if both t1 and t2 have values and t1 is greater than t2; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Forever is considered greater than any finite value. Any comparison with an Automatic value returns false.

  • op_GreaterThanOrEqual(Duration,Duration)

    Determines whether an instance of Duration is greater than or equal to another instance.

    public static bool op_GreaterThanOrEqual (System.Windows.Duration t1, System.Windows.Duration t2);

    Parameters

    • t1
      Duration

      The first instance of Duration to compare.

    • t2
      Duration

      The second instance of Duration to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if both t1 and t2 have values and t1 is greater than or equal to t2; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Forever is considered greater than any finite value. Any comparison with an Automatic value returns false.

  • op_Implicit(TimeSpan)
    public static System.Windows.Duration op_Implicit (TimeSpan timeSpan);

    Parameters

    • timeSpan
      TimeSpan

      To be added.

    Returns

    • Duration

      To be added.

  • op_Inequality(Duration,Duration)

    Determines if two instances of Duration are not equal.

    public static bool op_Inequality (System.Windows.Duration t1, System.Windows.Duration t2);

    Parameters

    • t1
      Duration

      The first instance of Duration to compare.

    • t2
      Duration

      The second instance of Duration to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if exactly one of t1 or t2 represent a value, or if they both represent values that are not equal; otherwise, false.

  • op_LessThan(Duration,Duration)

    Determines if the value of one instance of Duration is less than the value of another instance.

    public static bool op_LessThan (System.Windows.Duration t1, System.Windows.Duration t2);

    Parameters

    • t1
      Duration

      The first instance of Duration to compare.

    • t2
      Duration

      The second instance of Duration to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if both t1 and t2 have values and t1 is less than t2; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Forever is considered greater than any finite value. Any comparison with an Automatic value returns false.

  • op_LessThanOrEqual(Duration,Duration)

    Determines if the value of one instance of Duration is less than or equal to the value of another instance.

    public static bool op_LessThanOrEqual (System.Windows.Duration t1, System.Windows.Duration t2);

    Parameters

    • t1
      Duration

      The first instance of Duration to compare.

    • t2
      Duration

      The second instance of Duration to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if both t1 and t2 have values and t1 is less than or equal to t2; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Forever is considered greater than any finite value. Any comparison with an Automatic value returns false.

  • op_Subtraction(Duration,Duration)

    Subtracts the value of one instance of Duration from another.

    public static System.Windows.Duration op_Subtraction (System.Windows.Duration t1, System.Windows.Duration t2);

    Parameters

    • t1
      Duration

      The first instance of Duration.

    • t2
      Duration

      The instance of Duration to subtract.

    Returns

    • Duration

      If both instances of Duration have values, an instance of Duration that represents the value of t1 minus t2. If t1 has a value of stem.Windows.Duration.Forever* and t2 has a value of stem.Windows.Duration.TimeSpan*, this method returns stem.Windows.Duration.Forever*. Otherwise this method returns null.

    Remarks

    The following calculations all return a value of Automatic.

    • Forever minus Forever.

    • TimeSpan minus Forever.

    • TimeSpan minus Automatic.

    • Forever minus Automatic.

    • Automatic minus Automatic.

    • Automatic minus Forever.

    • Automatic minus TimeSpan.

  • op_UnaryPlus(Duration)

    Returns the specified instance of Duration.

    public static System.Windows.Duration op_UnaryPlus (System.Windows.Duration duration);

    Parameters

    • duration
      Duration

      The instance of Duration to get.

    Returns

    • Duration

      An instance of Duration.
